text: hey <@U25PYL3Q8> that worked - didn't think about it as a string so much as just setting a variable. but it makes sense.

heads up: I just changed the the authentication requirements for the HubDB REST API to list tables. Before it would allow anyone to see all published tables. Now you need a valid authentication to see the list of tables. The rest of the APIs are unchanged.
<@U22PJPGK0> is this documented in the api docs? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/get_tables>
also when you say valid authentication do you mean an apikey?
Authentication is described in the overview doc. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/hubdb_overview>
Any auth should work including api key
Sounds good, I just want to make sure the documentations gets updated to show it now needs authentication. Is there any plan on requiring authentication for getting table info or rows?
auth is only required for private tables on GETs
